column4: I'm trying to get a new ipod working on ubuntu. ubotus quide is useless, does anyone knowhow to do this?
what prob are you running into
and what kind of ipod 5.5 gen?
is it a windows or mac ipod
try sudo mkdir /media/ipod; sudo mount -o umask=000 /dev/sdb2 /media/ipod
if it worked on win its fat32 windows is not intelligent enought to understand many file formats without help
unplug it and replug then type 'dmesg | tail' does it say sdb or sdc or what
dmesg | grep "  sd" file.txt | awk "{print $ 4}" | tail -n 1   says what thats a little involved but i copied it from one of my mount scripts :-)
so if you sudo cfdisk /dev/sdb it shows no partitions?
you have any music saved on it or is it pretty new ipod
you know what model it is?
it seems there may be some issues with new nano and linux
however it has been addressed im just not sure if current packages in gutsy are late enough version to work
i never had a problem mounting it. i suppose worst case you could run xp in vmware or virtualbox
i hereby will you my old copy of xp
sorry wasnt more help. not sure what the issue is i know you can fix it by redoing the partitions in inlinux but youd need to backup your music
